items.text: Thirsty after eating it! Not very worth it. Ramen champion at illuma is better, tastier, cozier n value for money. Long queue after 7pm.
I prefer Marutama.. The broth is a little oily and pork isn't as succulent here..
Meals come in S, M & L sizes! Food here is delicious too, and the waiters are very friendly and welcoming. Worth coming here to dine! 😋
Salty soup base. Feel thirsty after eating.
Classic full-bodied tonkotsu flavours.
Spicy ramen!!
Watch out for this rude & sour-faced old waitress named ANNIE!! Super RUDE service. Not going back to Santouka anymore
Always go for pork cheeks. Always.
If you are feeling warm, ask the staff to turn on the fans.
Additional 7% GST + 10% service charge. Lunch set was pretty good, ramen was good, but the chicken karage is just okay.
Service staff at the queue with a remarkable attitude, she's probably having a really bad time with her period.
This place got no chio  waitress!
If you come during peak periods, they won't say you til your whole party is here
Tip: large groups should avoid this place. Eating area cramp n small, not comfy. Service staff hurries you and if everyone is not present at queue, u cant get a table inside!
Top 5 ramen in Singapore
The Kara Miso ramen and egg taste good! It's a must try!
Order pork cheeks! Shoyu is nicer than Shio soup base.
The pork cheek ramen here is amazing.
Goooooooooooo
Best ramen in town. Try the kara-miso ramen.
Roasted pork cheeks are so yummy; they melt in your mouth.
PORK CHEEK
Their miso ramen soup base is excellent! Shio is a little too salty though. Regular size might a little small for the average guy; upsize it! :)
My favorite is the tokusen toroniku shio ramen. The best one in town!!!
Curry miso was disappointed uncurry
The best Ramen in Singapore! Order Awase Aji Ramen (special combination soup) plus Tokusen Toroniku (pork cheek meat) and they're too good to be true for 2 pax!
Service quality has dropped. But maybe it's just this guy. He's rude, he interrupts and it just sets a bad tone to the meal.
Always love their pork cheek. But they have changed their chef recently, and the pork cheek I have today were so hard and tasteless. Feedback to their staff, hope they will listen and improve on it.
The singapore river looks like a drain here.
The Nama Karashi ramen is quite good here.
some say it's the best, maybe not for me... but still good to eat, probably second best after Ramen Keisuke Tori King in Tg Pagar and Amara Shopping Mall
The shoyo ramen, char siu gohan and char siu pao taste so yummy and quite affordable.
The shoyu ramen is great ! Recommend it a lot ! Service is also not bad ^^
Biggest shop among the Santouka chain
Order a regular ramen but save $1 by down-sizing it. Great for small eaters, or if you want to try other sides.
Order the special pork cheeks char siew ramen
Don't order the set meals, way too much food. The noodles come in large enough bowls.
perfect brooth!
Shio ramen is their marquee dish.
One of the best ramen restaurants you can find in Singapore. You have to try it to believe it!
Shiokness ramen. Go early for the choice pork which comes in limited quantities.
Awesome pork meat! try the pork cheek ramen! but the soup base is a tad salty! drink more water!
安定感あり、接客よし
Forget Ippudo, this ramen joint is DA BEST. Must order - choice pork!
FTW. Top Ramen bowl in the area!
Bad service here,the Cuppage outlet is much better!
Not bad, but felt a bit over rated :( maybe coz they keep chasing me as there is a long queue. But worth going compare to many other places :)
Went for the ramen. おおいし！！
You could choose the broth flavour! Shio, Miso, Shoyu, or Kara-miso. The char siu is really awesome! And the black pig gyoza is a must-try as well! The restaurant has a good view of the river
The gyoza also good! Make the sauce with soy sauce + vinegar to make it even better.
Tasty ramen and some good value sets available. Must get the pork cheeks pao...or two
The Shio is popular choice but a little too subtle as I was expecting more salty. Pork cheeks too oily. I prefer Marutama.  #ThomtoriEats
Available in S, M, and L size of ramen. Pork cheek ramen is a must try! Very tender! But they are limited in quantity, so come early if u can. Tried the miso ramen, also good.
Pork cheek ramen! Pricey but a worthy indulgence once in a while!
From 9 Nov 2014 they don't open on Sundays any longer. Darn it!
Ramen: Super yumz each time we come here. Basic good flavours, especially w their shio (salt) base. Must eat: pork cheek ramen
Be prepared to drink lots of water later.. So thirsty after half hour of ramen..
Their signature pork cheeks are tender but really salty. The broth is salty too so it quickly becomes unpleasant. Hit Marutama Ramen on the third floor instead.
1 for 1 for JCB card holder!
Register yourself as member and they always offer a lot of surprises to customers!
Ask for a loyalty card and claim half portion of pork cheeks on your 2nd visit and a free bowl after your 5th bowl :)
forget Ippudo. this Ramen joint is DA bomb. must order - choice pork!
Santouka yum. But somehow the Shio is popular choice but a little too subtle as I was expecting more salty. Pork cheeks too oily. I prefer Marutama.  #ThomtoriEats
Try the Tonkotsu Ramen Set With Salmon Ikura Don - Babe order thus must have set even when he claimed he was not hungry!
Pay by JCB card you can get 1for 1.
small ramen and ikura rice combo equals perfection 🍜🍥🍚
Hidden gem! Everything is good here, but try the salmon don set menu. YUMMMMM.
Definitely go for their specialty pork cheek ramen. Worth the additional cost! Their soup base is on the salty side, so you may want to get your water (or tea) ready.
Kara Miso is not as spicy as one would thought. It's a must try for those who has been eating the norm (soup) base all these while. Pork cheek bun is sensational!
The best ramen in Singapore ❤️
Ramen with pork belly!!
The shoyu soup base n pork is a bit too salty for my liking
The green tea is 4 bucks!!! Teabag somemore!!!
Pork Cheek Ramen servings are huge, so go easy on the sides.
Miso ramen so-so but cha-su slices are fatty and nice. Haven't tried tokusen toroniku. Still prefers Ippudo's.
So far this is the best ramen that I've ever eaten
Awesome ramen!
Tokusen toroniku ramen is everyone's favorite! I love their negi-meshi :9
The Tokusen Toroniku (pork cheek) ramen is heavenly! Tender, flavourful yet still retaining its chew. Wonderful place to dine alone, facing beautiful Clarke Quay.
One of the few Ramen places in town that consistently serves a perfected Ramen Egg (Tamago). Solid but soft on the inside.
If you want tsukemen you better come for lunch, in the evening they are out of it
The pork is amazing!
Love the pork cheeks. Best ramen for me so far....
